unnormalised: **Entertainment News: Bollywood's Festive Fireworks (and Maybe a Few Damp Squibs)**
normalised: **Entertainment News: Bollywood's Festive Fireworks (and Maybe a Few Damp Squibs)**

unnormalised: Bollywood's box office is gearing up for a crazy Diwali season! Three massive movies are slated to clash, promising more drama than your average Bigg Boss episode.
normalised: Bollywood's box office is gearing up for a crazy Diwali season! Three massive movies are slated to clash, promising more drama than your average Bigg Boss episode.

unnormalised: First up, "Desi Avengers," starring Ranveer Singh as the super-charming 'Chulbul Pandey' type. Critics are already calling it a potential Rs. 300 crore earner.
normalised: First up, "Desi Avengers," starring Ranveer Singh as the super-charming 'Chulbul Pandey' type. Critics are already calling it a potential rupee three hundred crore earner.

unnormalised: Then we have "Kabhi Eid Kabhi Christmas 2: Electric Boogaloo," starring Salman Khan. Early reports suggest it features a groundbreaking dance sequence set entirely inside a biryani pot. Take that, Hollywood!
normalised: Then we have "Kabhi Eid Kabhi Christmas two: Electric Boogaloo," starring Salman Khan. Early reports suggest it features a groundbreaking dance sequence set entirely inside a biryani pot. Take that, Hollywood!

unnormalised: And finally, a dark horse: "Nani Teri Morni Ko Chor Le Gaye: The Revenge." A remake of a 1970s classic, but this time, the grandma fights back. Expect flying chappals and lots of melodrama.
normalised: And finally, a dark horse: "Nani Teri Morni Ko Chor Le Gaye: The Revenge." A remake of a nineteen seventies classic, but this time, the grandma fights back. Expect flying chappals and lots of melodrama.

unnormalised: Analysts predict audiences will be queuing up from Delhi to Kanyakumari.
normalised: Analysts predict audiences will be queuing up from Delhi to Kanyakumari.

unnormalised: Will it be a blockbuster Onam for the industry, or will one film become a soggy idli? Only time (and ticket sales) will tell!
normalised: Will it be a blockbuster Onam for the industry, or will one film become a soggy idli? Only time (and ticket sales) will tell!
